summary: An Ordinance providing for the relief of certain property owners in the Local Improvement District assessed for the improvement of Broad Street from John Street to Mercer Street, et al., being Local Improvement District No. 779, and authorizing the City Treasurer to accept the amount of the original assessment levied on certain properties within said district without penalty or interest up to and including the 30th day of January, 1907, and extending time of payment of first installment, and repealing Ordinance No. 13228, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the relief of certain property owners in the Local Improvement District assessed for the improvement of Broad Street, from John Street to Mercer Street; Sixth Avenue North from Harrison Street to Mercer Street; Taylor Avenue from Harrison Street to Republican Street; Seventh Avenue North from Harrison Street to Prospect Street; Eighth Avenue North from John Street to Valley Street; Republican Street from Fifth Avenue North to Fairview Avenue; Mercer Street from Fifth Avenue North to Westlake Avenue and Roy Street from Sixth Avenue North to Lake Union, and authorizing the City Treasurer to accept the amount of the original assessment levied on certain properties within said district without penalty or interest up to and including the 29th day of January, 1907, and extending time of payment of first installment", approved January 16, 1906.
